translation.en: [woman] People think dreams are an escape.
[woman] A chance to slip away from waking life to a world with no consequence.
translation.ko: 결과를 생각하지 않아도 되는 삶으로 도망칠 기회라고

translation.en: -But that's not true. -[haunting choral music playing]
[woman] Your dreams don't just happen.
We make them happen.
And we design them with care just for you.
We have our reasons, and we have our rules.
We make your dreams to help you on your journey.
translation.ko: 우린 당신의 여정을 돕기 위해 꿈을 만들죠

translation.en: And where this one's going, she's gonna need all the help she can get.
translation.ko: 이 아이의 여정에는 가능한 모든 도움이 필요할 거예요

translation.en: [exhales] Good morning, Pig.
-Morning, Bugsy. -[Bugsy squawks]
-[Dad grunting] -[girl] Hey, Dad. What'd you get?
[sighs] Many leagues have I traveled across the sea to bring you breakfast.
translation.ko: 너 아침 차려 주려고 멀리서 가져온 것들이지

translation.en: Oh. Thank you. Here. Here, let me help you with that.
-Is that better? -Thank you.
-Yeah. -[Dad grunts]
-Hey, Bugsy! -[Bugsy squawks]
[Dad] All right.
Batter up.
And… batter up.
-[breeze blowing] -[Dad] We on course, kiddo?
[girl] The wind's come around.
So what're you gonna do?
Bow up.
-[tiller squeaks] -Bow up.
-[wrench straining] -A little more. Little more.
[Dad] Here ya go, kiddo.
His name is Fred. Oh, hi, Fred.
And I've got Seymour.
Dad, why do I have to learn math
if I'm gonna take care of the lighthouse, like you?
translation.ko: 난 어차피 아빠처럼 등대지기 될 텐데

translation.en: I already know everything there is to know about the lighthouse anyway.
translation.ko: 이미 등대에 관해선 모르는 것도 없다고요

translation.en: Answer me this question.
What is a lighthouse for?
To keep ships safe.
[Dad] No. That's not what it's for.
But when you can answer that question…
translation.ko: 그 질문에 답할 수 있을 때

translation.en: I'll give you the key to the lighthouse, and that's a promise.
-[girl gasps softly] -[Dad] Now, bed.
You don't want Pig?
[clicks tongue] I am 11.
Well, sorry, Pig. It's a rite of passage.
What's that?
Oh, no. No, you don't have to worry. I'll still be here for you.
translation.ko: 저런, 걱정 마 난 계속 네 옆에 있을게

translation.en: All right. Well, good night.
Wait!
-[Dad] Hmm? -One story?
-Flip story? -[girl gasps excitedly]
All right.
I got one you never heard before.
As you know, Flip and I, we lived the outlaw life. Hmm?
Hunting treasure every night, and… eh, what have you.
translation.ko: 밤마다 보물찾기도 하고 뭐, 기타 등등

translation.en: Now, one day ol' Flippy comes up to me, and he says, "Guess what I've heard."
translation.ko: 어느 날 플립이 오더니 재미난 얘길 들었다는 거야

translation.en: [quietly] He's heard about these Pearls. Magic Pearls.
translation.ko: 그러더니 진주 얘길 했어 마법의 진주

translation.en: You get one of these Pearls, and you can wish for whatever you want.
translation.ko: 그 진주만 있으면 어떤 소원이든 빌 수 있대

translation.en: The trouble was that these Pearls can only be found
in the most dangerous waters known to mankind.
-[eerie music playing] -The Sea of Nightmares.
Well, soon as I heard that, I was all, "Count me out. I don't want anything to do with it."
translation.ko: 듣자마자 그랬지 '난 빼 줘, 그딴 건 안 해'

translation.en: Then, of course, Flip, you know him, he goes and he does… the Double-Knock.
translation.ko: 아니나 다를까 플립은 비장의 무기 '똑똑'을 썼어

translation.en: And when your partner does the Double-Knock--
-You can't refuse. -[Dad] That's right.
[both] Outlaw Code.
Set sail, we did.
Well, I tell you what, it was cold. It was mighty cold.
But I was thinking, well,
in that kind of climate, Flip might not smell so bad.
translation.ko: 그렇게 추우면 플립의 악취도 덜하겠다 싶더군

translation.en: Then the storm came.
[softly] And the waves.
-Suddenly there was this rumbling sound. -[thunder rumbles]
-It was all around us. -[floorboards creak] -[Dad] And it grew louder by the second. -[wind picks up]
translation.ko: 그 소리는 우리를 둘러싸더니 점점 커져 갔지

translation.en: [Dad] It was the biggest, deadliest whirlpool I'd ever seen.
translation.ko: 그렇게 크고 무시무시한 소용돌이는 처음 봤다

translation.en: That boom swung around, hit me on the backside,
translation.ko: 배의 활대가 빙글 돌아 엉덩이를 치는 바람에

translation.en: and tossed me into that water.
And down I went, like a lead weight.
Down… and down,
until I noticed there was a hole right there in the bottom of the sea.
translation.ko: 그런데 내려가다 보니 바다 밑바닥에 구멍이 있는 거야

translation.en: So I swam in.
What's on the other side?
It's a dead place.
No life of any kind,
just littered with bones of ancient sea creatures.
translation.ko: 고대 바다 생물들의 뼈만 널려 있지

translation.en: That's when it came for me.
The monster.
-It rose up out of the darkness. -[low growling]
[Dad] Black as night, and bigger than any creature I had ever seen.
translation.ko: 밤처럼 검고 내가 본 어떤 생명체보다 컸어

translation.en: With long, smoky, inky tentacles.
translation.ko: 연기와도 같은 길고 새까만 촉수를 보니

translation.en: I was frozen in fear.
And it just, kind of slowly…
-[distorted] …slowly… -[monster snarls]
…reached out and grabbed me and shook me for all I was worth! And I take--
translation.ko: 손을 뻗어서 날 붙잡고 힘껏 흔들었어, 그래서 난…

translation.en: Stand by.
-[radio chatter continues] -Wait, you can't stop now.
What? You mean during the scary part?
-It wasn't scary. -[Dad] Mm-hmm.
It was a potentially interesting start to a story.
-[Dad] Go for Peter. -Potentially… interesting start.
[Peter] Copy.
-[indistinct radio chatter] -[Peter] Nemo, listen to me. There's a fishing boat off Lopez that's in trouble.
translation.ko: 니모, 로페스 앞바다의 어선에 문제가 생겼는데

translation.en: It's gonna get bad out there tonight.
Listen, you know what to do if the power goes out, right?
Fire up the backup generator,
translation.ko: 예비 발전기 켜고 오수 펌프 비우고

translation.en: clear the sump pump, radio Carla if there's a problem.
translation.ko: 예비 발전기 켜고 오수 펌프 비우고 문제 생기면 칼라한테 무전 치기

translation.en: [giggling] I got it, Dad.
Sweet dreams.
Hey… I got you.
[inhales sharply] Stop.
Good night.
[Peter] Good night. I'll be back soon.
[echoing] Dad?
Help! Help!
Help! Help!
[frantically] Help!
Help!
Carla?
[Nemo] Carla, where's my dad?
Nemo,
he's gone, honey.
He's gone.
[shakily] I'm sorry.
-[Nemo crying] -[Carla] Those were his wishes. Did he talk with you about any of this?
translation.ko: 피터의 뜻이에요 이런 얘기 나눈 적 없어요?

translation.en: Her mother died when she was a baby, so she's used to a single-parent household.
translation.ko: 아기 때 엄마가 세상을 떠나서 아빠랑 사는 게 익숙한 애예요

translation.en: She doesn't have anybody else.
It's you, or she becomes a ward of the state.
translation.ko: 당신이 안 하면 나라에서 맡게 될 텐데

translation.en: They'll stick her in a group home or in foster…
Nemo, do you remember your uncle?
No. I've never met him before.
Your dad left instructions.
If anything ever happened to him…
he wanted you to go and stay with your uncle in the city.
But I have to take care of the lighthouse.
Nemo, you can't live alone.
But I can do it. I know how. He's taught me everything.
translation.ko: 저 다 할 줄 알아요 아빠가 다 가르쳐 줬어요

translation.en: -[Carla] I'm sorry, honey. -[Nemo breathing shakily]
[man] "For tho' from out our bourne Of Time and Place
The flood may bear me far"
"I hope to see my Pilot face to face
When I have crost the bar"
[softly] That's him.
[quietly] Hello?
No, it's not a good time.
My uh… My brother was lost at sea.
Mm. No, lost lost. Like, I'm at his funeral.
We were estranged, actually.
Estranged.
I'm… I'm happy with my plan.
-Carla. -Hello.
Hello.
[sighs] I'm so sorry for your loss.
Our loss, obviously.
Um, we can…
We better hit the road if we're gonna catch the ferry.
translation.ko: 지금 나서야 페리를 탈 수 있어

translation.en: -[horn honks] -Uh, no shoes on the carpet. -Oh, I'm sorry. -No…
translation.ko: - 신발 신고 카펫 밟지 마 - 죄송해요

translation.en: It's a great building.
You never have to leave. [chuckles]
Which I basically never do 'cause I work from home.
translation.ko: 나갈 일도 없긴 해 재택근무 하거든

translation.en: Sorry.
There's a dry cleaner's, a coffee shop.
They even have a, um… a spinning studio downstairs.
Are you into spinning?
Like spinning around?
I don't know. I… I've never tried it.
Hey… [spluttering]
Do you like doorknobs?
These are my babies.
You're a doorknob salesman?
[scoffs] I'm not… I'm not a doorknob salesman.
I own a company that sells doorknobs.
We sell latches. We sell escutcheons.
Here's where we differ.
A lot of the glamour boys in the industry, they chase the latest trends, not us.
translation.ko: 난다 긴다 하는 회사들도 최신 유행을 쫓아다니지만 우린 달라

translation.en: No, thank you. We'll stick with the classics.
'Cause it's security. It's not fashion.
-Don't touch that. -Oh, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
That's not a toy.
This is an antique.
Came from a prison cell in Alcatraz.
In case I need to lock you in your room. [chuckles]
I-- I-- I'm not gonna lock you in your room.
That was… humor.
[splutters] Do you need a hug or whatever?
No.
Well, good night.
[Nemo, softly] I know, Pig. I wish we could be with him again too.
translation.ko: 알아, 피그 나도 아빠랑 살던 때가 그리워

translation.en: Pig.
-What? -[Pig oinks]
Wait!
-[Pig grunts, squeals] -No.
[Nemo] Don't! Stop, stop! Wait!
Stop! Pause. Pause. Pause. Pause.
No! No, no, no! No! [gasps]
Stop! Stop! No, no, no, no, no! No! No!
[Nemo] Red light. Stop!
-[tapping] Red light! -[Pig oinks]
-Come on, Pig. -[Pig squealing]
-[taps] Thanks. -[Pig grunts]
-[Nemo] Hi, Bugsy. -[Bugsy caws]
Dad?
-[loud thumping upstairs] -Dad?
Dad?
Who are you?
Nobody? [laughs nervously]
I'm just one of those weird things that happens in dreams.
translation.ko: 꿈에서 일어나는 요상한 일 중 하나지

translation.en: Ignore me. I'm leaving now.
[man, high-pitched] Come back later. We're doin' dishes.
[gruffly] 'Kay, so that didn't work.
So, you're the kid.
What are you doing here?
And where's my dad?
[scoffs] Nobody told you?
I know what happened.
[sighs, grunts] Well, your dad and I were partners a long time ago,
before he went straight and had a kid.
Big mistake, in my opinion. [chuckles slightly, sighs deeply]
[snarling] Mad, bad, and dangerous to know.
Named Flip.
-You're Flip? -[grunts softly] Yeah.
I thought you were something my dad made up,
and you're different than I imagined.
Handsomer?
More "gorgeous-er," if you will?
Hairier.
-And… [sniffs] …smellier. -[Flip] Hmm.
I mean, I know you're not real,
but I always pictured, like, a normal human being.
Okay, you just said like four insulting things on top of each other.
Rude.
-Listen, I just came to pay my respects. -[fly buzzes, splats]
[chewing] Sorry for your loss. Hi-yah!
By ripping my dad's room apart?
Oh, that reminds me…
[chuckling] …your dad, he had a map.
About this big. Weird shapes and lines all over it.
translation.ko: 크기는 이 정도에 이상한 도형과 선이 그려져 있고

translation.en: Picture with an oyster with a pearl on the back of it.
It's one-of-a-kind, kid. We risked our lives stealing it.
translation.ko: 특별한 지도지 우리가 목숨 걸고 훔쳤어

translation.en: -I never saw any map like that. -[Flip] Don't lie to me, kid!
translation.ko: - 지도는 본 적 없어요 - 어디서 거짓말이야!

translation.en: Your dad would want me to have it.
I'm not lying.
Never mind, I'll find it myself. [blows a raspberry]
Hey, you can't just bust in here like some kind of thief.
-You say thief like it's a bad thing. -[glass shatters]
A thief just takes things that don't belong to them.
translation.ko: 도둑은 자기 게 아닌 물건을 가져갈 뿐이야

translation.en: You can't take things from other people's dreams.
translation.ko: 남의 꿈에서 막 가져갈 순 없죠

translation.en: [scoffs] Sure you can.
Ya just gotta know how to get in and get out.
I'm in your dream.
You're just a figment of my imagination.
You wish you could dream up somethin' this good. Look at that.
translation.ko: 이렇게 멋진 걸 네가 생각해 낼 수 있을까?

translation.en: Mm! I look good.
Please! I don't want you here.
I just want my dad.
[smacks lips] Okay.
What if there is a way you can see your dad again?
translation.ko: 네 아빠를 다시 볼 방법이 있다면?

translation.en: What do you mean?
I'm goin' on a little treasure hunt, and this treasure… is magic.
translation.ko: 보물찾기를 떠나는 거야 이 보물은 마법을 부려

translation.en: Lets you wish for whatever you want here in Slumberland.
translation.ko: 슬럼버랜드에서 어떤 꿈이든 꿀 수 있게 해 주지

translation.en: I could see my dad again.
Oh, yeah, you can see your dad again. Right here, every night.
translation.ko: 그럼! 다시 볼 수 있지 여기서 매일 밤

translation.en: But I'm gonna need that map, kid.
-[tense music playing] -I don't know what you're talking about.
[sucks teeth] Yeah, I believe you.
Hey, wait! I can try to find the map. I can still come with you.
translation.ko: 잠깐만요, 지도를 찾아볼 테니까 저도 같이 가요

translation.en: Oh, that sounds super fun.
Except you got no gear, no skills,
and without the map… oh, you're useless to me.
-[Nemo gasps] -Time to wake up, kid.
A map.
Oh, you're up already. Good.
What are you doin'?
What's the weirdest dream you've ever had?
I don't remember my dreams.
Don't actually think I have any.
I brought you some milk, right?
Are you, uh, excited for your first day of school?
School?
[Uncle] This place should be amazing. It costs a fortune.
translation.ko: 이 학교 좋을 거야 학비가 비싸거든

translation.en: My dad said schools are basically prisons.
They keep kids locked up physically and mentally,
prepare them for jobs that are also basically prisons,
until they retire and go to a nursing home.
Their final prison.
School is not a prison.
Can I leave whenever I want to?
translation.ko: 제가 원할 때 떠날 수 있어요?

translation.en: It's a little like a prison.
Bell doesn't help.
Nemo, hi. Welcome to Westbrook.
translation.ko: 니모, 안녕 웨스트브룩에 온 걸 환영해

translation.en: -I am Ms. Arya, lower school counselor. -Hey.
Hi.
Well, I know what a… a difficult time this is but, um…
Hey, do you know what the most resilient thing on earth is?
translation.ko: 세상에서 가장 회복력이 좋은 게 뭐게?

translation.en: It's not titanium.
Is it tungsten? It has a higher tensile strength--
The human spirit.
Oh, you mean metaphorically.
What you're going through, it's hard. But you know what?
translation.ko: 힘든 일 겪은 거 알아 하지만 말이야

translation.en: You are stronger than you know.
Hey, can we talk for a sec?
-Oh, yeah. -Just one sec. Uh…
I, uh, just wanted to prepare you.
[quietly] Nemo's dad kinda raised her like a hermit.
Not in a bad way, just… you have your work cut out for you.
translation.ko: 나쁜 쪽으로 그런 건 아니지만 고생 좀 하실 거예요

translation.en: She… She's gonna need a lot of emotional support.
Yeah. I mean, I'm hoping that you guys can help with all that.
translation.ko: 네, 특히 그 부분에 관해선 학교에 거는 기대가 커요

translation.en: Oh. Well, we can't do that all by ourselves.
-No. -[both chuckle]
-Right? -Right. Obviously.
Is that not something you do?
Look, I don't know how to take care of a little kid or talk about feelings.
translation.ko: 저는 어린애를 돌보거나 감정에 관해 말하는 방법을 몰라요

translation.en: Now, I think that she would be better off literally anywhere else.
[softly] Okay.
Oh, you have my hands.
You are capable of more than you think.
-[chuckles] Truly. You just gotta… -[chuckles lightly]
You just gotta connect with a part of yourself that you're not used to accessing.
translation.ko: 익숙하진 않겠지만 자기 안의 문을 열어 보세요

translation.en: You just gotta connect with her.
-Just try. -Okay.
-[door opens] -Hi, everyone. Hi.
[quietly] Thanks, Ms. Young.
Hi, guys. How's everybody doing?
This is Nemo. She's gonna be joining your class.
translation.ko: 얜 니모라고 해 너희랑 같은 반이 될 거야

translation.en: So if you could all just make her feel right at home, I would be so grateful.
translation.ko: 니모가 편하게 적응하도록 도와주면 너무 고맙겠다

translation.en: Sorry.
Okay, everyone. Listen up.
In a victory for planet Earth,
we got compostable utensils in the cafeteria.
translation.ko: 학교 식당에 퇴비화 가능한 식기가 도입됐어

translation.en: We won!
Hmm. Uh, Nemo, Jamal.
-Jamal, Nemo. -[Jamal] It's a seven-day cycle.
translation.ko: 쟤는 자말이고 얘는 니모야 7일 주기로 돌아가

translation.en: You're late, you get a blue dot.
Three blues, and you get a red dot, and your parents get a notification.
translation.ko: 파란 점 3개면 빨간 점 1개고 부모님한테 연락이 가

translation.en: And you can get the app for your phone.
I don't have a phone.
That is refreshing.
You're gonna need the app, though.
Any clubs you're into?
I'm on recycling team, Model UN, ceramics club,
translation.ko: 난 재활용 팀, 모의 UN 도자기 동아리, 팝 타르트를 해

translation.en: Pop-Tarts, that's our improv group,
translation.ko: 난 재활용 팀, 모의 UN 도자기 동아리, 팝 타르트를 해 즉흥극 극단이야

translation.en: lawn bowling, Slavic chorus, orchestra, woodworking, ultimate Frisbee…
translation.ko: 론 볼링, 슬라브 합창단, 관현악단 목공, 얼티미트 프리스비도…

translation.en: Where'd you go to school before this?
I didn't. I was homeschooled.
Um, my dad and I lived in a lighthouse.
A lighthouse? That sounds awesome.
Why'd you move here?
My…
My dad's on a trip. That's why I'm here. I'm staying with my uncle, just temporarily.
translation.ko: 아빠가 출장을 가서 난 임시로 삼촌네서 살게 됐어

translation.en: Oh. Cool.
Those are my Undeadheads.
We dress up as zombies and watch zombie movies.
It's cooler than it sounds… I think.
Uh, come sit with us.
Um, I… I need to do my math.
[Jamal] Okay.
I have a great activity we can do together.
translation.ko: 우리가 같이 할 재밌는 놀잇감을 찾았어

translation.en: Lockpicks.
Probably from some master thief. Or maybe just a retiring locksmith.
translation.ko: 어떤 대단한 도둑이나 은퇴한 자물쇠 장수 거였겠지

translation.en: That cool?
I first learned to do this when I was about your age.
translation.ko: 네 나이쯤 됐을 때 이걸 처음 배웠어

translation.en: I was the first kid in school interested in door hardware.
translation.ko: 문 부속품에 흥미를 느낀 애는 학교에서 내가 처음이었다

translation.en: [Uncle] Now, the trick… is to move both slowly.
translation.ko: 양쪽 다 천천히 움직이는 게 요령이야

translation.en: Feel for the catch.
Before you know it…
Houdini who? Houdini me. That's Houdini who.
translation.ko: 누가 누가 잘 여나 내가 내가 잘 열지

translation.en: That's a little… mantra. You don't have to say that.
translation.ko: 나만의 주문이야 꼭 말할 필요는 없어

translation.en: Wanna have a go?
I'm a little doorknobbed out.
That's fine. We can, um… [clicks tongue]
We'll do something else. We'll, uh…
play soccer.
We could play soccer. Wanna… uh, build a pillow fort?
Are you reading a list off your phone?
-Yes. Yes, I am. -[phone locks]
I'm gonna just…
Oh, sure. Totally.
Pig?
Pig, what are you doing?
[Nemo] Oh my gosh, Pig.
You found it.
Come on, Pig. Let's go find Dad.
Boring book, boring book, boring…
See ya.
Um, I have to check my schedule. Can I see your phone?
translation.ko: 시간표 확인하게 폰 좀 보여 주실래요?

translation.en: Uh, yeah.
[Uncle] Look at you, using apps. See what happens when you try?
translation.ko: 앱도 척척 쓰네 해 보면 다 된다니까

translation.en: [Nemo] Yup, just learnin' new stuff all the time.
[Nemo] Oh, Flip.
Come on, Pig.
[echoing] Flip?
Flip?
-[metal clanging] -[Flip laughing]
-[Nemo] Flip! -[tool clatters]
[Flip] You.
I found the map.
I knew I liked you. [chuckles]
-You tried to kill me. -I was trying to wake you up.
translation.ko: 날 죽이려고 했잖아요 깨우려고 그랬지 어차피 네 꿈에선 안 죽거든

translation.en: Everybody knows you can't die in your dreams.
translation.ko: 깨우려고 그랬지 어차피 네 꿈에선 안 죽거든

translation.en: You told me about this in my dream, and then I find it in the Waking World.
translation.ko: 꿈에서 알게 된 지도를 깨어 있는 세상에서 찾았어요

translation.en: How is that possible?
[clicks tongue] Maybe the real world's bigger than you thought.
translation.ko: 진짜 세상이란 게 생각보다 큰가 보지

translation.en: [Nemo] Hey! It's my map. You can't just take it.
Yeah, well, I hate to break it to you, kid.
Taking people's stuff's kind of my thing.
translation.ko: 남의 물건 뺏는 게 내 일이야

translation.en: -[Flip gasps] -You said I could see my dad again. I'm coming with you.
translation.ko: 아빠를 다시 볼 수 있다면서요? 나도 갈래요

translation.en: Listen, that's real sweet and all, and I miss your dad too,
translation.ko: 훈훈한 사연이고 나도 네 아빠 그립지만

translation.en: but you're not comin'! Go away.
What was that?
Double-Knock.
He told you about the Double-Knock?
You have to take me. Outlaw Code.
Oh, don't tell me about the Outlaw Code.
I'm one of the cocreators of the Outlaw Code.
Before me, it was just one knock.
This isn't some Girl Scout trip to Lollipop Land, okay?
We're gonna have to travel through people's dreams to get to that treasure.
translation.ko: 남의 꿈에 들어가서 보물을 찾아야 한다고

translation.en: So you get killed, it's on you.
You said you can't die in a dream.
I said you can't die in your dream. You die in your dream, you wake up.
translation.ko: 네 꿈에선 안 죽는댔지 거기서 죽으면 깨어나지만

translation.en: You die in someone else's dream, you don't wake up. Ever.
translation.ko: 남의 꿈에서 죽으면 영영 못 깨어나

translation.en: I don't care. I'm coming.
Fine.
You slow me down, you screw things up, this map is mine, and you're on your own.
translation.ko: 너 때문에 늦어지거나 일 틀어지면 이 지도는 내 거야 - 넌 갈 길 가는 거고 - 좋아요

translation.en: -Deal. -Let me see your gear.
translation.ko: - 넌 갈 길 가는 거고 - 좋아요 장비나 꺼내 봐

translation.en: [under breath] Double-Knock.
What is this? Extraordinary Knobs.
It's my Uncle Philip's. He's a doorknob salesman.
He has no friends, no life, and he makes me go to school.
translation.ko: 친구도, 인생의 낙도 없고 날 학교에 보냈어요

translation.en: What a monster.
Well, this'll put you to sleep faster than any sleeping pill.
Okay, here. You hold on to this when you fall asleep.
That way, you can find me when we're on the road. Okay?
translation.ko: 그래야 길을 나섰을 때 날 찾을 수 있으니까

translation.en: -[Pig burps] -What the heck is that?
[Nemo] He's a pig, and his name is Pig.
Super creative. Fine. Bring him. I love bacon.
translation.ko: 참 창의적이군, 좋아, 데려가 나 베이컨 좋아해

translation.en: All right. Look at this.
The World of Dreams.
This is a map of every dream in the world. Slumberland.
translation.ko: 세상의 모든 꿈이 담겨 있는 지도지 이게 슬럼버랜드다

translation.en: Your dad and I used this map to go on all our adventures back in the day,
translation.ko: 네 아빠랑 난 이 지도로 온갖 모험을 했지

translation.en: jumpin' from dream to dream, to wherever we wanted to go.
translation.ko: 이 꿈 저 꿈을 넘나들며 어디든 다 갔어

translation.en: We swiped this map from a dream cop at the Bureau.
translation.ko: 이 지도는 단속국의 꿈 경찰한테서 슬쩍했는데

translation.en: She's been chasing me ever since.
The Bureau?
Bureau of Subconscious Activities, BOSA.
Unfortunately for us, they're the bozos that decide what you get to dream.
translation.ko: 우리가 무슨 꿈을 꿀지 정해 주는 멍청이들이지

translation.en: Unless you end up here.
-The Sea of Nightmares. -[thunder crashing]
Sea of Nightmares. My dad told me about that.
That's where the Pearls are.
[Flip] Greatest treasure in the world.
The sticky part is those dream cops at the Bureau
don't want us to know they even exist.
Because you get your hands on one of those bad boys,
and you can wish for whatever you want here in Slumberland.
translation.ko: 슬럼버랜드에서 어떤 소원이든 빌 수 있으니

translation.en: And it's out of their control.
I could see my dad again?
If you don't die. Which you probably will.
translation.ko: 네가 안 죽으면 그렇겠지 죽을 게 뻔하지만

translation.en: Oh my God. Your dad would kill me if he knew I was doing this.
translation.ko: 이러는 거 알면 네 아빠가 날 죽일 텐데

translation.en: All right, listen, we're looking for reoccurring dreams.
That way, we can get out the same way that we got in.
translation.ko: 그래야 들어갈 때랑 같은 방법으로 나오지

translation.en: Where's the door?
What door?
[sighs] The Bureau puts in secret doors to connect the dreams.
translation.ko: 꿈들을 연결하려고 단속국에서 설치한 비밀 문

translation.en: Civilians aren't supposed to know, unless you're a genius like myself.
translation.ko: 나 같은 천재가 아니면 민간인은 알 수가 없지

translation.en: [martial arts shout] Look out!
Okay, that was definitely not here before.
All right, we go through this door, everything changes.
translation.ko: 자, 이 문을 통과하면 모든 게 달라진다

translation.en: You slip up, you're dead. You'll never see the Waking World again.
translation.ko: 까딱 실수하면 죽어 깨어 있는 세상과는 작별이지

translation.en: Okay. [takes a deep breath]
What are we waiting for?
That's the spirit.
All right. Welcome to my world, kid.
translation.ko: 자, 내 세계에 온 걸 환영한다

translation.en: Brand-new dream, still under construction.
Elegante. Spanish for "I look good."
I'm a flippin' outlaw, so I don't play by the rules.
But here's the rules.
Rule number one, keep a low profile.
We don't wanna get caught messin' around in other people's dreams, trust me.
translation.ko: 남의 꿈을 들쑤셔 놓는 걸 들켜서 좋을 건 없거든

translation.en: -If the dream pigs catch you, they will-- -[Pig grunts]
Oh. My bad, buddy.
If the dream cops catch you, they will lock you up and throw away the key.
translation.ko: 꿈 경찰들은 우릴 잡아 가두고 열쇠는 내버리지

translation.en: Doomed to rot in a dingy Bureau prison cell
for all of eternity till you cease to exist entirely.
translation.ko: 칙칙한 감방에서 영원히 썩다가 먼지처럼 사라지는 거야

translation.en: So blend in.
Yeah, 'cause you totally blend in.
Rule number two, stay focused.
[whistles] We're not here to have fun, okay?
We get in, we find the next door, then we get out.
translation.ko: 들어간 다음 다음 문을 찾아서 나와야 돼

translation.en: Onto the next dream. Our one and only mission is finding those Pearls.
translation.ko: 다음 꿈으로 가는 거지 우리 목적은 진주 찾기니까

translation.en: Rule number three. We're not friends. We're not partners.
I am the boss. El Jefe, 'kay? We do as I say, you got it?
translation.ko: 내가 대장이다, '엘 헤페' 말이야 무조건 복종해, 알았지?

translation.en: So rule number three's just a bunch of aggressive statements?
Nobody likes a smart aleck, kid.
-[in Spanish] Excuse me. -[Flip] Hey, buddy. What's up?
Are you sure you're in the right dream?
I don't see you on my list.
The girl represents long-lost childhood.
translation.ko: 얘는 잊고 지내던 어린 시절을 나타내는 존재죠

translation.en: I'm a troubling mix of a father figure
and raw, masculine power.
And… what is this?
Brother…
[in English, with Spanish accent] …sometimes a pig is just a pig.
Silly puerco.
Yes.
[in Spanish] Library.
[clears throat] Perdón.
Do you party?
No, I don't.
You party. I party.
[mutters] Okay.
-Gracias. -Okay.
[in English] What was that?
I don't know Spanish. That's the only word I know.
Leave it to the pros. That's me. That's professional.
translation.ko: 프로한테 맡겨 나 같은 프로 말이야

translation.en: Ooh, it's all about the Miss D, misdirection. Did you know that? Boop!
translation.ko: 상대가 한눈팔 때가 기회야 전혀 몰랐지? 뿅!

translation.en: I don't even know if this is real. Oh, that's real.
Now we're talkin'. [laughs]
Who wants the Waking World when you got all this, huh?
translation.ko: 깨어 있는 세상이 이런 걸 어떻게 이겨?

translation.en: [Green] Oi! Agent Green.
translation.ko: 어이, 잠재의식 활동 단속국의 그린 요원이에요

translation.en: Bureau of Subconscious Activities. This the thieving punk you rang about?
translation.ko: 어이, 잠재의식 활동 단속국의 그린 요원이에요 이 도둑놈을 신고한 게 맞아요?

translation.en: [Green] Cheers, mate.
Our next door
is behind the stage, yeah. [chuckles]
[band leader, in Spanish] And now, the Salsa Queen of Old Havana!
[in English] There's our dreamer.
-[laughs] Classic repression dream. -[Nemo] What's that?
Well, you never heard of Freud? [in singsong] Repression.
All those feelings get bottled up, and they go busting out in Slumberland.
I guarantee she's nothin' like that in the Waking World. Believe me.
translation.ko: 깨어 있는 세상에선 전혀 다른 모습일걸, 장담한다

translation.en: [in Spanish accent] You see me? Yes.
[in Spanish] Mm! What is that scent?
[in English] It's au naturel. By Flip.
[sighs, in Spanish] Such raw, masculine power.
Gracias.
But at the same time… a deep sadness.
Like a lost little boy, far from home.
translation.ko: 집에서 멀리 떠나 길을 잃은 소년처럼

translation.en: [sighs] Dance with me.
[in English] Hey! You said we weren't here to have fun.
I said you're not here to have fun. I'm an outlaw.
translation.ko: 그건 너한테 한 얘기였지 난 무법자야

translation.en: If I'm not havin' fun, I'm doin' my job wrong.
translation.ko: 내가 안 노는 건 직무 유기라고 뭔지 알지?

translation.en: [in Spanish] Who's she?
Go away, Nemo. You'll ruin the nice lady's dream. -Buh-bye. -[Nemo grunts]
translation.ko: 가라, 니모 멋진 숙녀의 꿈을 망칠라, 안녕

translation.en: -[wings flapping loudly] -Flip!
-[music grows sinister] -[Nemo] What about the Pearls?
[Nemo, whimpering] Flip!
[panting] Flip? Please!
[Flip] What the Flip?
That's no bueno.
Adiós. Let's get to that door, fast.
Hello, Flip. Where's that map?
[snarls] Green.
I've been waiting for this for a long time.
The dream cop.
You're under a--
[shakily] What… the…?
"What the…?" [chuckles]
[Flip] Nightmare!
Look out!
[grunting and straining] Oh my God!
Ew, yucky!
-[music fades] -[Flip] Holy moly.
It took years for me to shake that cop off my tuchus.
translation.ko: 그 경찰 따돌리느라 몇 년을 고생했건만

translation.en: First dream out with you, I get her and a nightmare?
translation.ko: 너랑 길을 나서자마자 그 경찰에 악몽까지?

translation.en: You're like a bad luck charm.
And I don't get it. That nightmare flew right past the dreamer.
translation.ko: 이해가 안 돼 악몽이 꿈 주인을 지나쳤거든

translation.en: [sighs] Why the heck was it coming after us?
I've seen it before.
The night my dad died.
It's yours. It's your nightmare.
What?
You brought the nightmare. Nightmares smell fear.
translation.ko: 네 두려움의 냄새를 맡고 악몽이 따라붙은 거야

translation.en: It's tracking you, and nightmares won't stop until they get you.
translation.ko: 악몽은 널 잡을 때까지 멈추지 않을 거다

translation.en: [panting] Do you ruin every party you go to?
I've never even been to a party.
I never should've brought you. Give me the map back.
No. I did the Double-Knock.
Give it to me!
[Flip] What is that?
No, no, no. Don't-- Don't wake up! Don't wake up!
No, give me… give me the map!
-Hey. -Uh, what are you doing here?
Checking my mushrooms.
Mushroom club. It's a… one-person club.
Are you hiding out down here?
No.
'Cause I mean, you weren't in class,
and this looks a little bit like a secret hideout, so…
translation.ko: 여긴 뭔가 비밀 은신처 느낌이 나니까…

translation.en: School thinks I'm on a trip, and my uncle thinks I'm at school.
translation.ko: 학교에선 내가 여행 간 줄 알고 삼촌은 수업 듣는 줄 알아

translation.en: Hardcore.
Uh, you won't tell anybody I'm here, though, right?
translation.ko: 나 여기 있는 거 비밀로 해 줄래?

translation.en: Omertà, the vow of silence.
You can try some of my mushrooms.
translation.ko: 내 버섯 먹어 봐 근데 털고 먹어야 돼

translation.en: Just brush 'em off first. It's manure.
translation.ko: 내 버섯 먹어 봐 근데 털고 먹어야 돼 거름이 묻어 있거든 내 똥 아니니까 오해는 마

translation.en: It's not my poop, so it isn't weird or anything.
translation.ko: 거름이 묻어 있거든 내 똥 아니니까 오해는 마

translation.en: Bye.
See ya. [sighs]
Hey… [sighs]
…squirt. [chuckles]
Can I take the… I wanna show you something really cool.
translation.ko: 가방 이리 줘 진짜 멋진 거 보여 줄게

translation.en: You ready?
And… surprise.
I arranged with Carla to get it here,
and I figured maybe this Saturday we could go sailing.
I mean, you could go sailing.
I'm strictly a dry-land guy due to my sensitive bowels.
translation.ko: 난 완전히 육지 체질이거든 장이 워낙 예민해서 "방랑자"

translation.en: You should sell it or something.
I don't think I wanna sail anymore.
[Philip] Nemo, I know this is hard.
And different and scary.
But I think it would be a mistake if you shut yourself off from the world,
translation.ko: 하지만 세상과 담을 쌓는 건 실수라고 생각해

translation.en: like your dad did.
What are you talking about?
Your dad was… different before.
And then, when your mom died--
My dad wasn't shut off.
[scoffs] Nemo, he moved to an island.
Do you ever go anywhere or do anything?
translation.ko: 삼촌은 어디 가거나 뭐 한 적 있어요?

translation.en: Do you have any actual friends? Doorknobs don't count.
translation.ko: 진짜 친구가 있긴 해요? 문손잡이는 빼고요

translation.en: [scoffs] I'm just saying, don't be afraid to… I don't know, have fun again.
translation.ko: 내 말은, 겁먹지 말고 다시 재밌게 지내란 거야

translation.en: I'm not afraid of anything.
-I'm gonna go to bed. -[mouthing] What?
It's like 5:30.
I know you wanna sleep all the time because you're sad.
I know that feeling.
But life is what happens when you're awake.
translation.ko: 하지만 삶은 깨어 있을 때 돌아가

translation.en: Not mine!
[whining] Go to sleep. Go to sleep. Go to sleep.
-Damn it. This is interesting! -[book thuds]
You okay?
I just wanna sleep.
Maybe if you tried putting on some pajamas.
This is what I wear to bed.
Okay, well, what did your dad do to help you get to sleep?
translation.ko: 좋아, 아빠는 잠 안 올 때 뭘 해 줬어?

translation.en: Sometimes… he'd tell me stories.
Aren't you a little old for that?
-Never mind. -[Philip] No, it's fine.
I can try to make up a story.
Okay. Sorry, I didn't realize you were gonna be watching me. That's… That's fine.
translation.ko: 미안, 그렇게 빤히 볼 줄은 몰랐거든, 괜찮아

translation.en: This is a story based on a true story
about a man…
on Christmas Eve…
I think.
Who took delivery of 30,000 porcelain doorknobs
translation.ko: 그 사람은 프랑스의 공급업자한테서 도자기 문손잡이 3만 개를 배달받았지

translation.en: from a supplier in France,
but instead of being three inches in diameter,
these knobs were three centimeters. [chuckles]
Try fitting a metric doorknob onto a standard escutcheon.
translation.ko: 미터법으로 측정한 문손잡이가 표준 장식쇠에 맞을 리가 없지

translation.en: -What to do? -[gentle music playing]
You would need a Christmas miracle.
But then our hero realized
that these little knobs were the perfect size
translation.ko: 이 작은 손잡이가 표준 수납장 서랍 손잡이로 딱 맞는 크기라는 걸

translation.en: for standard cabinet drawer pulls.
translation.ko: 표준 수납장 서랍 손잡이로 딱 맞는 크기라는 걸

translation.en: You must be exhausted. That was the exciting part.
[kisses] Good night, Nemo.
Flip.
Well.
You came back.
[grunts] I'm impressed.
-I'm proud of you. -Really?
Nah. Go away. Go home.
translation.ko: 그럴 리가, 가 버려, 집에 가

translation.en: I don't have a home. Without that Pearl, I don't have anything.
translation.ko: 집 없어요, 그 진주가 없으면 아무것도 없는 거예요

translation.en: You don't get it, kid.
Nightmares smell fear. And you, you're scared.
translation.ko: 악몽은 두려움의 냄새를 맡는데 넌 겁먹었어

translation.en: I'm not scared.
I mean it. [growls]
Just take your feelings, crumple 'em up in a little ball, and shove 'em down deep.
translation.ko: 네 감정을 동그랗게 뭉쳐서 깊숙이 쑤셔 넣어

translation.en: 'Cause I'm not doin' this for you. I'm doin' it for your dad.
translation.ko: 너 좋아서 봐주는 거 아니야 네 아빠를 위해서지

translation.en: Same.
Yeah? Yeah, double same.
-[Nemo] Pig! -[Pig oinks]
[Flip] No. No pigs. Get outta here.
-[Nemo] Come on, Pig. -[Pig snorting]
So, who are you in the Waking World? Or… what are you?
translation.ko: 아저씨는 깨어 있는 세상에선 어떤 사람이에요? 사람이긴 해요?

translation.en: Don't remember, don't care. [sighs] Haven't woken up for a long time.
translation.ko: 기억 안 나고 관심 없어 안 깬 지 오래라서

translation.en: Well, I mean, you kinda have to wake up.
Everybody wakes up. Not me.
After your dad quit the game before he had you,
translation.ko: 너 낳기 전에 네 아빠가 손 씻은 후로

translation.en: I just kept goin', y'know?
Door after door, dream after dream.
Then I realized…
[laughing] …I don't have to wake up.
You know, after a while, you sort of forget about the small details, like, uh,
translation.ko: 좀 지나니까 사소한 것들은 잊게 됐어

translation.en: y'know, who I am.
Anyhoo, when I get that Pearl, I'll have everything that I want.
translation.ko: 암튼, 그 진주만 있으면 원하는 건 다 가질 수 있어

translation.en: What are you gonna wish for?
[Flip] No more Agent Green would be nice.
All I want is my dad.
If I could see him, I don't really care what happens in the Waking World.
translation.ko: 그러면 깨어 있는 세상에선 어떻게 되든 상관없어요

translation.en: -Yeah, I miss your dad too. -[Pig sighs]
So, he told you all about me, huh?
-Every night. -Yeah, man. We were a heck of a team.
translation.ko: - 매일 밤 했죠 - 그래, 우린 환상의 팀이었어

translation.en: Goin' wherever we wanted, takin' whatever we wanted.
translation.ko: 원하는 곳 어디든 가고 원하는 건 뭐든 가졌지

translation.en: We were tippy-top of the Bureau's most wanted list.
[chuckles] Oh, man.
Now I think I'm down to 13, but… I'm bouncin' back.
I can feel it. [sniffs]
Anyways… [sighs, groans]
…I just can't get a bead on this next door. It keeps movin'.

translation.en: Oh man.
The door is in the truck. Shh.
-[Flip] Cool. Cool. -[Nemo] Cool. Cool. Cool.
-[sighs] Yeah, right? -[Nemo] Mm-hmm.
You party?
-Yeah, you party. -[Nemo] Yeah, I party so hard.
-Clear. -[high-pitched] Aww!
Shred the gnar!
Who dreams of driving a garbage truck?
Don't judge. At least it's original.
It's not like, "Oh my God, I didn't study for the test. Where's my pants?"

translation.en: Or, uh, "Hey, I'm ridin' a giant goose, eh?"

translation.en: I've never heard of the giant goose one before.

translation.en: Most popular dream in Canada, kid. Look it up.

translation.en: Green. [snarls]
-[gasps] Flip! -[bells ringing]
-[groans] Oh! [grunts] -[lever clicks]
Flip, help! Flip, help!
Green.
[echoing] Look!
Look at how strong I am.
Ta-da!
[Flip] Hurry, the door's in the cab.
You gotta be kidding me.
She does not give up.
Yeah, she wants her map back.
Oh, no.
This is awesome.
What kind of maniac is drivin' this thing?
-Go! Go! Go! Go! -[Nemo screams]
-[music swells, fades] -Oh, hello.
I'm driving my truck.
That explains the poor cornering skills.
Killer tats. Drive your truck faster, sir.
translation.ko: 문신 죽인다! 좀 더 빨리 갈까요?

translation.en: Oh, boy!
Where's the door? Uh…
Oh, here it is. Here, hold on to that. Hold on. [grunting]
It's locked. Of course it is. -Awesome. -[Green's engine revving]
[Flip] That's not ideal.
[Flip] Oh, great.
Again, not ideal.
Keep it together, kid.
-[panting] I can do this. -Oh, man.
You're a nightmare magnet.
Yeah!
Yeah! Ah!
Yeah.
That's what I call a getaway.
I thought you were gonna lose an arm.

translation.en: -I thought it was gonna get gross. -What are you doing?

translation.en: Normally I drip-dry,
but I learned this little ditty from a real gangster's dream.
Pretty rebellious, you know? Now put your hands up, ready? Here.

translation.en: ♪ Don't touch my horns 'Cause they hold up my halo ♪
translation.ko: 뿔은 건드리지 마 나 뿔날지도 몰라

translation.en: Come here.
Shoot 'em off.
♪ 'Cause we're outlaws Get off me, get off me! ♪
-[Nemo giggles] -[sighs] I'm proud of you.
We're gonna make an outlaw outta you yet.
-[gun beeps] -Run!
You made me work for it, I'll give you that.
Finally, I can retire, get some sun.
Thirty years.
Thirty years chasing your sorry butt for mucking up people's dreams.
translation.ko: 30년간 남의 꿈을 망쳐 놓는 네놈을 쫓아다녔지

translation.en: I'm 160. I should have retired ages ago, but no.
translation.ko: 난 160살이야, 진즉에 은퇴해야 했는데 못 했어

translation.ko: 내 보드에서 네놈 이름을 지울 수 없었으니까

translation.en: Well, I got you now.
All-inclusive. One of the top-rated dreams in Slumberland.

translation.en: I'll be sure to send you a postcard.
In jail, of course.
Not like there's any glory in it. Whoop-de-do!

translation.en: I caught Slumberland's 28th most wanted.
-[watch beeps] -[Flip groans] Twenty-eight? Try 13.
You're slippin', mate.
-Right. You're under arrest. -[high-pitched] Aww!
You got nothin'.
You brought a squid to a salsa party. Do you think that's funny?
translation.ko: 살사 파티에 오징어를 데려간 게 웃기다고 생각해?

translation.en: [Flip chuckles] Put it that way, it's kinda funny. Right?
Oh, okay.
With popcorn, they're delicious.
[whispering] Pick those up.
You just put those in there. I know I didn't do that.
I stole that fair and square.
-[Green] Where's my map? -[Flip scoffs] Your map?
translation.ko: 내 지도 어딨어? 당신 지도? 언제 적 얘기야 어딨는지 난 몰라

translation.en: It's ancient history. I have no idea where that map is.
translation.ko: 당신 지도? 언제 적 얘기야 어딨는지 난 몰라

translation.en: And who's this? Your bodyguard?
Who, her? Yeah, I dragged her along. Got nothing to do with it. It was all me.
translation.ko: 쟤? 그냥 내가 달고 온 애야 아무 상관도 없어

translation.en: You've done a lot of crime, Flip. -You're gonna do a lot of time. -[faucets squeak]

translation.en: [Green] As in forever.
[Green] All right, let's get you locked up and find that map, why don't we?

translation.en: I'm actually gonna miss hunting you down.
translation.ko: 널 쫓던 게 그리워질 것 같아

translation.en: Oi! [whistles] Here.
If it makes you feel any better, you could just let me go.
translation.ko: 그리워할 바엔 그냥 풀어 줘도 될 텐데

translation.en: Nah, it's gonna make me feel really good to lock you up.
translation.ko: 아니, 널 가두는 게 훨씬 신날 거라서

translation.en: [chuckles] You make that sound kinda fun.
That was inappropriate. I'm… I'm sorry.
-[elevator dings] -You think you're this big man.
-But you're just a pathetic little-- -Hey, Cindy.
Oh! Hey, Frank.
Cindy? 160-year-old Cindy.
[mockingly] Sassy Cindy.
-[grunts, softly] Sorry, Cindy. [sniffles] -[display panel beeping]
So, uh, still over in Oedipal dreams?
Uh, no. They moved me to 6200.
Oh. That's exhausting.
Hey, at least I get my steps in, right?
Waffle?
You're just a pathetic little man-boy.
-Thank you. -[Green] Mm.
We run a finely tuned machine here.
We can't have losers like you botching up the works.
And I've met punks like you before.
"Slumberland, just one nonstop party!" "I'm never gonna leave!"
And then one day, you realize… you're all alone.
translation.ko: 그러다 문득 깨닫지 네가 혼자라는 걸

translation.en: You've got no friends, no family.
No one gives a damn about you, all because you didn't want to wake up.
translation.ko: 아무도 너한테 관심을 안 줘 깨어나길 거부한 네 탓이지

translation.en: What do you think I'm tryin' to do?
[Green] Well, now you'll just be a vague memory.

translation.en: -Flip, you had a good run. Mm. -[elevator bell dings]
But now, you're done.
No! No! No! No!
Please! Stop! Stop! No!
[Flip] Forget it, kid. We're in here for good.

[sighs] There's nothing we can do.
I thought you didn't wanna wake up.
I can't.
When you stay in Slumberland too long, you forget everything.

translation.ko: 진주만 있으면 내가 누군지 기억날 것 같았어

translation.en: I just wanna wake up.
She's right.
Nobody gives a damn about me.
I do.
Bodyguard, come with me.
What about him?
[Green] Oh, he's checked in for good.
But he can't help it.
-He doesn't remember who he is. -Chop-chop. Well, now he can remember.
translation.ko: - 자기가 누군지도 모른다잖아요 - 빨리 나와 이제부터 기억해 내면 돼 남는 게 시간이니까

translation.en: He's got loads of time.
translation.ko: 이제부터 기억해 내면 돼 남는 게 시간이니까

translation.en: -Sorry it didn't work out, kid. -[cell door squeaks, clangs]
Not many people get to peek behind the curtain.
translation.ko: 커튼 뒤를 엿볼 수 있는 사람은 드물지

translation.en: -Want to see where the magic happens? -[phones ringing]
Welcome to the Bureau of Subconscious Activities.
translation.ko: 잠재의식 활동 단속국에 온 걸 환영한다

translation.en: Clearly, management hasn't updated our wardrobe or the facilities since the early '70s,
translation.ko: 경영진이 1970년대 초 이후로 의상이나 시설을 갱신하지 않았어

translation.en: 'cause the Bureau blows its budgets on the dreams, and we get the leftovers.
translation.ko: 단속국에서 꿈에다 예산을 쏟아붓는 바람에 우리한테 떨어진 게 별로 없었거든

translation.en: So, two ways this can go.
You can end up like Flip, alone, in a cell forever.
Or I can cut you loose,
but I'm only going to do that if you've learnt your lesson.
translation.ko: 하지만 풀려나려면 뉘우친 모습을 보여 줘야 돼

translation.en: Otherwise, you can go straight to rot in a cell in juvie. [exhales]

translation.en: So, looks like you're going through some stuff.
translation.ko: 그래 힘든 일을 겪은 것 같구나

translation.en: We gave you the lighthouse dream.
translation.ko: 그래서 등대 꿈을 준 거야 거기서 넌 안전하니까

translation.en: That's your safe place. The nightmares can't get you there.
translation.ko: 그래서 등대 꿈을 준 거야 거기서 넌 안전하니까 거기선 악몽이 널 못 잡지

translation.en: But my dad's not there.
I wanna see my dad.
Yeah, we don't give you what you want. We give you what you need.
translation.ko: 우린 네가 원하는 게 아니라 너한테 필요한 걸 줘

translation.en: Everything in Slumberland happens for a reason.
translation.ko: 슬럼버랜드에서 일어나는 일에는 다 이유가 있단다

translation.en: You're messing with a finely tuned machine here, love.
translation.ko: 넌 정교하게 굴러가는 조직을 건드린 거야

translation.en: Then give me a dream with my dad.
-And I'll never leave. -Yeah. No dream lasts forever. All right?
translation.ko: - 거기서 안 떠나게요 - 그래 영원히 지속되는 꿈은 없어 알겠니?

translation.en: Sooner or later, they all fade.
You're gonna visit the lighthouse for a little while,
translation.ko: 잠시 동안은 등대에 가는 꿈을 꿀 거야

translation.en: and then it's gonna be gone, then you'll have other dreams.
translation.ko: 그러다 그게 끝나면 다른 꿈이 나타나지

translation.en: You'll move on.
I don't wanna move on.
[sighs] If you don't move on, the nightmares will find you, and they will destroy you.

translation.en: Then how do I make them go away?
By being brave.
And when you're brave enough, then they can't hurt you.
translation.ko: 네가 충분히 용감해지면 악몽도 널 해치지 못해

translation.en: I'm not afraid of anything.
Being brave isn't about not being scared.
translation.ko: 용감한 것과 겁이 없는 건 달라

translation.en: It's about doing what you have to do, even when you are.
translation.ko: 겁이 나도 할 일을 하는 게 용감한 거지

translation.en: And I know you're not afraid of car chases or jumping off cliffs.
translation.ko: 넌 자동차 추격이나 절벽에서 뛰어내리는 걸 겁내진 않지만

translation.en: I'm talking about what you're really scared of. Being alone.
translation.ko: 진짜 겁내는 게 따로 있잖아 혼자 남는 거

translation.en: Someday, you're gonna find something new.
translation.ko: 언젠가 새로운 걸 찾게 될 거야

translation.en: Something so important
that you're going to stop trying to hold on to what's already gone.
translation.ko: 지나간 일에 매달리기를 멈추게 하는 거

translation.en: And when that happens,
that big scary squid that's been chasing you around?
translation.ko: 널 따라다니던 그 크고 무서운 오징어는

translation.en: It'll vanish into thin air.
No more nightmares.
Until puberty.
Yeah, that whole thing's a frickin' nightmare.
You think some magic Pearl's gonna solve all your problems?
translation.ko: 마법의 진주가 모든 문제를 해결해 줄 것 같지?

translation.en: Let me let you in on a little secret.
[whispering] There are no Pearls. It's a myth.
Stay where you belong.
Nemo, you have the dream you're meant to have. We make sure of that.
translation.ko: 니모, 넌 꿔야 할 꿈을 꿀 거야 우리가 그렇게 만들지

translation.en: Time to wake up.
Hey. Can't sleep?
Me neither.
You know, things get darkest right before the dawn.
The world's stupid that way. [chuckles]
[crying] I'm never gonna see him again.
I wanna show you something.
Sit down.
I haven't looked through this stuff in years.
translation.ko: 몇 년 만에 꺼내 보는 거야

translation.en: Where is…? Ah.
[softly] Come on.
That's your dad.
That's my dad?
[Philip] I worshipped him back then.
Your dad and I, all we really had was each other.
He told me stories too… every night.
translation.ko: 나한테도 이야기를 해 줬어 매일 밤

translation.en: Wild adventures we were gonna go on.
Long-lost treasure we were gonna find.
We lived in a fantasy world.
Probably 'cause it was better than the real world.
Red string?
Right, that was our special trick
for finding each other in our dreams. [chuckles]
Your dad and I were convinced we'd figured out
translation.ko: 네 아빠랑 난 우리가 꿈속에서 만나

translation.en: how to meet up in our dreams and go on those adventures.
Flip?
How'd you know about that?
You're dressed like Flip. I don't understand.
Flip was my outlaw name.
I was pretty shy. When I was with other kids, I barely spoke.
translation.ko: 수줍음이 많아서 딴 애들이랑 말도 거의 안 했는데

translation.en: But when I was with your dad in our dreams,
I could be whoever I wanted to be.
And for me, that was Flip.
And then your dad met your mom, and she was so great.
translation.ko: 네 아빠가 네 엄마를 만났는데 너무 좋은 사람이더라

translation.en: Looked just like you.
And um… they decided to have a real adventure.
translation.ko: 그러다가 두 사람은 진짜 모험을 떠나기로 했지

translation.en: I begged him not to go.
But off they went, sailed around the world.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 세계 일주 항해를 했어

translation.en: And then I was alone, and I shut down, even worse than before.
translation.ko: 혼자 남은 나는 전보다 더 마음의 문을 굳게 닫았지

translation.en: You said you don't remember your dreams.
-That's when it started, right? -[clicks tongue] Yeah, I guess.
translation.ko: 그때부터 그런 거 맞아요? 응, 아마도

translation.en: I was pretty broken up about it.
I didn't sleep for three nights.
And after that, no more Flip.
I was just Philip.
Your dad would call from time to time to check in,
translation.ko: 네 아빠가 가끔 전화해서 안부를 물었는데

translation.en: and he'd tell me about all his crazy adventures.
And he'd ask me what I was doin', and…
I'd have to tell him all about my boring life.
[shakily] So after a while, I just…
let him go to voice mail.
Anyway… ancient history now.
I moved on. I'm sure he did too.
I have to go back.
I mean, I have to get ready for school.
Uh, ready? What? It's like 5:00 a.m.
I've got a lot to do.
Can I borrow your lockpicks… for school?
Go ahead. Take 'em.
My dad didn't move on.
He told stories about you every night.
Nemo. Hey.
I gotta go.
I heard Davenport and Arya talking about her.
translation.ko: 선생님들이 쟤 얘기 하는 거 들었거든

translation.en: You know why she moved here, right?
Her dad died.
-[wings fluttering] -Excuse me. Sorry. Sorry.
-[truck door slams] -[Nemo panting] Hey, kid. -I'm driving my truck. -[Pig oinks]
translation.ko: - 안녕, 꼬마 - 내 트럭을 모는 거야

translation.en: -I know. -[hatch squeaks]
You, out.
-Long-lost childhood. -[Pig snorts]
[in adult's voice] Babies.
Obviously.
-[elevator rattles, bell dings] -Oh, well. [chuckles]
Time to make the doughnuts.
-[baby] Have a nice day. -[Pig snorts]
[quietly] You came back for me.
You gotta come for your partner, even if he's a pain in the--
translation.ko: 파트너를 버릴 순 없죠 - 아무리 짜증 나는… - '님'이라도!

translation.en: -Applesauce! -Tie this while I get you outta here.
translation.ko: - 아무리 짜증 나는… - '님'이라도! 손가락에 묶어요, 꺼내 줄게요

translation.en: Oh, I know. [laughs]
Pickin' locks?
-I knew you were an outlaw. -[lock clangs]
Houdini who? Houdini me. That's Houdini who. [giggles]
translation.ko: 누가 누가 잘 여나 내가 내가 잘 열지

translation.en: -Whoa, check this out. -What do we got here?
-[Red] Hey. -[Pig oinks]
[in Brooklyn accent] Say, uh, I'm from juvie, and this guy was stealin' from us.
translation.ko: 난 소년원 소속인데 이놈이 우리 걸 훔치더군

translation.en: [scoffs] Toys, candies, puppy dogs.
Yeah, you got nothin' on me, kid. [growls]
-You like wreckin' kids' dreams, scumbag? -[Flip whimpering]
You like tearin' the heads off of teddy bears, huh? Huh? Huh?
translation.ko: 곰 인형 머리 잡아 뜯는 게 특기야?

translation.en: -[Flip groans] -How 'bout I tear your head off?
[crying] Guys, take me away. She's so mean.
Juvie, man. They do not mess around.
Yo, I gotta bail.
-Right. -Okay, see you after lunch.
[Flip] Is this really necessary?
-[Flip] Well, that's awkward. -[sighs] You must be having a laugh, mate.
Let's see how tough you are without that thingamabobber.
translation.ko: 그 총인지 머시긴지 없이 붙어 보자고

translation.en: Okay. Want some of this, do ya?
-Yeah? Ready for it? -[Flip] Yeah!
Oh, man. [whines, panting]
You're so tough for a 160-year-old lady.
You're under a--
It's all about misdirection.
You're gonna make me really regret being so nice to you. [gasps]
translation.ko: 친절하게 대해 준 걸 후회하게 만드는구나

translation.en: Yes. Excuse me, Cindy.
-[Nemo] Excuse me. Excuse me. -Pardon me. Uh…
How's this gonna work? Oh, boy.
-There ya go. Ah, okay. -[Nemo] Ow.
Here we go.
-And you. -[elevator bell dings]
-Hey, here. -[Nemo] Oh.
-Get a "momento." -[Nemo] Ah.
-Yeah, right. -[Nemo] Say cheese.
Fromage!
-Perfect. -[Flip gasps]
-[elevator bell dings] -Sorry. Sorry.
-[Flip] Sorry, not sorry. -[Nemo laughs]
All right. Okay, hey, look.
Yeah.
This elevator's gonna take us right where we wanna go.
The last stop before the Sea of Nightmares.
translation.ko: 악몽의 바다로 가기 전 마지막 관문

translation.en: [laughing] We're gonna get our Pearls.
Yeah, about that. I have to tell you something.
Okay, well, just wait a second.
[snickers] Classic, right?
[chuckles] Yeah. There are no Pearls.
[sighs, chuckling slightly] What're you talking about?
It's a myth. Agent Green told me.
And you believed her? [scoffs]
She was just tryin' to keep you in your place.
It ain't no myth, believe me.
-How do you know? -'Cause your dad saw them.
We were there. Sea of Nightmares?
Yeah, he went all the way down the whirlpool. All the way to the bottom.
And then he saw the Pearls, thousands of 'em.
translation.ko: 거기서 네 아빠가 진주 무더기를 본 거야

translation.en: Your dad had the greatest imagination… but he would never lie.
translation.ko: 네 아빠가 상상력은 풍부했어도 거짓말할 사람은 아니야

translation.en: We can't go back.
We're not goin' back. [chuckles]
[Flip] C'mon, kid.
-[both panting] -Ooh, it's bright.
-[Pig squealing] -Much better.
Okay, here we go.
Pig!
Come on, kid!
The final door's gotta be out here somewhere.
translation.ko: 마지막 문이 여기 어디 있을 거야

translation.en: Keep goin'! Go! Go!
Oh, hey, hey, hey, hey. Whoa.
[Nemo] So, what do we do now?
[in Canadian accent] Whoa! Oh, hey there! How about this view, eh?
-Canada? -Like I said, number-one dream.
translation.ko: 캐나다죠? 캐나다에서 제일 인기 있는 꿈이라니까

translation.en: Go away! [grunts]
Eat this, Green!
-Come on, Flip! -What're you doin'?
-[Nemo] The geese! -[Flip] Oh, but you're crazy!
[Canadian] Whoa, hey!
[laughs] You think that's a thing of beaut?
Well, let me tell ya, there's a Timmies.
That's a Tim Horton's for ya. Pert near 20 clicks that way--
-Hey, buddy. -[Canadian] Oh, yeah, eh?
I wanna swipe your gooser here, eh?
Uh, yeah. Sure, bud. Scooch my goose.
[laughing] Keep your stick on the ice!
-Ooh. Right down there. -[goose honks]
Oh, man.
-Hey, Bob? -[giant goose honks]
-[Flip] That was awesome. -[loud honk]
-[Flip imitates honk, sighs] -Bye, Bob.
I think you and I should be partners. What do you think?
Look, there's something I need to tell you.
There it is! I found it before you!
-[laughing] -[Nemo] Race ya!
Last one there is a rotten dream!
-[energetic orchestral music playing] -Wait, wait, wait. -Be cool. Be cool. Be cool. -[Pig snorts]
[quietly] It's the final door.
And it's open.
-Which is a first. -[whispering] Why are you being quiet?
-[Flip] 'Cause it's scary. -[Nemo] And dark.
-[Flip] Yeah, and dark. -[Nemo] And creepy.
translation.ko: - 그리고 깜깜해요 - 응, 깜깜하지 - 게다가 으스스해요 - 그래

translation.en: [Flip] Yeah.
-[music swells] -[shouts] Hey!
I was just makin' sure no one's in there.
Well, you know, it's the gateway to the Sea of Nightmares, so… [chuckles]
translation.ko: 이 문만 통과하면 악몽의 바다야 그러니까…

translation.en: Pearls are in here somewhere. All right.
translation.ko: 진주가 여기 어디 있는 거지 좋았어!

translation.en: Okay.
Ready?
-[Nemo takes a deep breath] -Here we go, partner.
-I don't wanna go first. -It's okay.
-But I'm scared. -[Flip] It's an initiation, so…
-[Nemo] Okay. -[Flip] All right.
It's cold.
[Flip] That's a whole lot of water.
Okay. [clears throat]
Gonna go for a little swim. No big deal.
I know who you are.
I found out in the Waking World.
Why the hell didn't you tell me?
Wait. Do I still have my hair?
translation.ko: 잠깐만 - 머리카락은 그대로 있어? - 네, 그만큼은 아니지만

translation.en: Yeah. Just not as much.
translation.ko: - 머리카락은 그대로 있어? - 네, 그만큼은 아니지만

translation.en: Let me guess.
I'm a famous outlaw, yeah?
Men fear me? Ladies love me?
translation.ko: 남자는 날 겁내고 여자는 날 사랑하고?

translation.en: You're a doorknob salesman.
What'd you call me?
You're my dad's brother, Philip.
You and my dad came to Slumberland every night when you were kids.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 매일 밤 아빠랑 슬럼버랜드에 왔는데

translation.en: And then, he left.
Oh, wow.
After that, Philip stopped dreaming, and you couldn't wake up.
translation.ko: 그 후로 필립은 꿈꾸는 걸 멈췄고 플립은 못 깨어났죠

translation.en: I remember. But when you get your Pearl,
you can wake up, and you can be one person again.
translation.ko: 깨어나서, 다시 온전한 한 사람이 될 수 있어요

translation.en: This is a buzzkill.
I'm gonna get us both killed for that guy?
translation.ko: 고작 그런 사람 되는 일에 목숨 걸자고?

translation.en: We're so close, and he needs you.
translation.ko: 거의 다 왔잖아요 - 필립한텐 플립이 필요해요 - 난 필요 없어

translation.en: Well, I don't need him, all right? I got everything that I want right here.
translation.ko: - 필립한텐 플립이 필요해요 - 난 필요 없어 필요한 건 여기 다 있거든

translation.en: Wine, women, waffles. The three dubs.
Not necessarily in that order.
I'm not a knob seller.
I'm a flippin' outlaw!
But I thought that when we get our Pearls,
I could be with my dad at night, and during the day, I could be with you.
translation.ko: 밤엔 아빠랑 있고 낮엔 플립과 있을 수 있어요

translation.en: You could be like my part-time dad.
translation.ko: 저의 낮 시간 아빠가 되는 거죠

translation.en: I am nobody's dad, kid.
So you're just giving up?
I'll tell you what I'm gonna do.
I'm gonna go find a dream with a bar in it,
and then I'm gonna drink until I forget who I am again.
translation.ko: 내가 누군지 다시 잊을 때까지 마실 거야

translation.en: Then I'm gonna go find someone's ex. 'Cause there's a lot of them around here.
translation.ko: 누군가의 옛 여친도 찾아야지 그런 사람 널렸거든

translation.en: But I… I did the Double-Knock.
So did I, kid.
The night your dad left, I begged him to stay.
translation.ko: 네 아빠가 떠나던 날 가지 말라고 애원했다

translation.en: I'll go without you.
I'll see my dad again, and I don't care if I never wake up.
translation.ko: 아빠를 다시 만날 거예요 안 깨어나도 상관없어요

translation.en: Hey, no. You can't.
It's too dangerous to go in alone.
You can't tell me what to do… 'cause you're not my dad.
I never shoulda brought you.
Just go back to where you belong.
Otherwise, you're gonna end up like me.
Nemo.
[in a woman's voice] Nemo. Wake up.
Wake up!
-[Nemo gasps, shudders] -[Arya] Nemo?
Get your things.
We're calling your uncle.
[Arya] It's not just the lying, Nemo.
translation.ko: 단순한 거짓말이 아니야 니모, 그런 식으로 빠져나가면 어떡하니?

translation.en: It's sneaking off like that. No one knew where you were.
translation.ko: 니모, 그런 식으로 빠져나가면 어떡하니? 어디 있는지 아무도 몰랐고

translation.en: For all we knew, you could've been in terrible danger.
translation.ko: 엄청나게 위험한 일이 생겼을 수도 있어

translation.en: Yeah.
Why would you do that?
You wouldn't understand.
Why don't you try me?
Okay.
Well, m-- Maybe it would help if, uh… if you went first.
Philip?
Would you like to tell Nemo how you're feeling?
I don't know what you want me to say. I don't do feelings.
translation.ko: 무슨 말을 하길 바라시죠? 감정 같은 거 없는데요

translation.en: Everyone does feelings, whether you like it or not.
translation.ko: 누구나 감정은 있어요 좋든 싫든 간에요

translation.en: You two are in the same boat. You just don't realize it.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 한배를 탔는데 깨닫지 못할 뿐이에요

translation.en: Guys, come on. You're both struggling with powerful emotions,
translation.ko: 둘 다 강렬한 감정과 씨름하고 있다고요

translation.en: and you just… you just need to deal with them.
Do we, though?
Um, everybody always says that, but… I'm not convinced.
I-- I-- I've [scoffs] I've never dealt with my feelings, and I'm fine.
translation.ko: 제 감정을 딱히 마주한 적 없지만 괜찮거든요

translation.en: I was fine.
Should've just had them send me to foster care.
You'd probably be better off.
At least foster parents know how to be parents.
translation.ko: 위탁 부모는 부모 노릇이 뭔지는 알 테니

translation.en: Nemo, we should probably talk.
I don't wanna talk. You wanna get rid of me, so get rid of me.
translation.ko: 얘기하기 싫어요 날 버리고 싶으면 그냥 버려요

translation.en: [sighs] I'm not trying to get rid of you, Nemo. I'm… I'm trying to help you.
translation.ko: 널 버리려는 게 아니야, 니모 도우려는 거지

translation.en: You're as bad as he is.
What? Who?
You only care about yourself.
Are you kidding? I have done nothing but take care of you.
translation.ko: - 자기밖에 모르잖아요 - 장난해? 널 돌보느라 온 힘을 쏟았어

translation.en: I-- I-- I cook. I-- I entertain.
I try.
And what do I get in return? You just lie to my face.
translation.ko: 그런데 돌아온 건? 눈앞에서 날 속였지

translation.en: I think we're bonding, and I let you borrow my precious lockpicks so--
translation.ko: 우리가 통한 줄 알고 귀한 자물쇠 따개도 빌려줬는데…

translation.en: Nobody cares about door stuff, okay? Why do you think you have no friends?
translation.ko: 문손잡이에 관심 갖는 사람은 없어요 삼촌이 왜 친구가 없겠어요?

translation.en: Why do you think you live alone?
You should go to your room!
Where do you think I'm going? You're not my dad!
translation.ko: 내가 어딜 가겠어요? 그리고 아빠도 아니잖아요!

translation.en: Hey, I'm not trying to be!
I live alone because I like it that way!
translation.ko: 내가 혼자 사는 건 그게 좋아서야

translation.en: I didn't ask for any of this to happen. I didn't ask you to come live here!
translation.ko: 난 이런 상황을 바란 적도 여기서 살아 달라고 한 적도 없어!

translation.en: But I'm glad you did.
Pig, we're goin' home.
[Philip] Nemo?
No, I don't know. I don't--
Carla, I don't know. I just woke up, and she wasn't here.
translation.ko: 칼라, 몰라요 일어나 보니 애가 없어요

translation.en: Well, I have no idea where she would go.
Right.
Pig!
-Oh, yeah. [laughs] -[air-raid sirens wailing]
[Flip] Oh! The End of the Line!
-It's party time! -[neon sign buzzing]
Yeah, baby! Oh!
Number one! Top of Slumberland, baby!
You see that?
Hope they catch the bastard. [Flip] Oh, yeah.
translation.ko: - 그 자식 좀 잡혔으면 - 아, 네

translation.en: Guy seems like a real bad egg. You know? Pee-yew.
He took a little girl to the Sea of Nightmares,
translation.ko: 어린 여자애를 악몽의 바다로 데려갔다가 버려서

translation.en: and then he ditched her, and she went in alone.
translation.ko: 어린 여자애를 악몽의 바다로 데려갔다가 버려서 애가 혼자 갔대요

translation.en: -What? -Yeah.
Hey, you're…
A shiny pink diamond?
-Yeah. Pretty, isn't it? Hi-yah! -That's nice.
[Nemo, echoing] Come on, Pig. Grab one, and let's go.
[exclaims] Yeah!
Flip?
[Nemo] Flip!
[Flip] I got ya. Oh!
Get in the cab!
You came back for me!
Yeah. Outlaw Code. Never leave your partner behind.
translation.ko: 그래, 무법자 규정상 파트너를 버릴 순 없어

translation.en: -Even if she is a pain in the… -Applesauce.
Applesauce! [laughs]
Oh! I got a Pearl.
Oh! Aces!
So long, suckers!
Oh, hey! Hey, guys!
-[Pig squeals] -[screaming] Nightmare!
[laughing] Whoo!
We have to get to the lighthouse! Green said it's my safe place!
translation.ko: 등대로 가요, 그린 요원이 거기선 내가 안전하댔어요!

translation.en: I know!
Don't look down!
-Pull up! -I am!
translation.ko: - 어떻게 해 봐요! - 잘 안 돼!

translation.en: -[Nemo screaming] -Oh my! Oh my!
-[grunting] -[Nemo whimpers] No! Drive the plane!
-Flip, come on. Flip! -[Pig oinks]
[Canadian] Aw, jeez. What a gong show.
Okay, one minute, you think you're going out for a rip…
Oh. Hey, sorry, guy.
And the next thing you know, you're goin' for a dip.
There he is.
-[Canadian whimpering] -Get in here!
Come on. Hey, Emmett, you party? I party.
Come here! Get in here!
[in Southern accent] Hey, Emmett, take a right.
Here we go.
-I can't. I can't. What's that? -Come here, buddy.
Hit it, Emmett!
Help! Oh, my hair! My hair!
[in Spanish] I knew you'd return!
I smelled your musk.
Uh, sí, sí, sí. Pero no.
Pero no.
-[Canadian gasps] -[announcer on TV] Now, McRoy to center.
There's O'Reilly… Great pass to Johnson, and a goal!
translation.ko: 맥로이가 중앙으로… 오라일리가 있네요 조지프에게 멋진 패스! 득점!

translation.en: -He scores! -Yes! Let's go! Let's go!
-[motor whirring] -[wind whipping] -[wistful piano music playing] -[thunder rumbling]
[sighs] We're gonna make it, kid.
Come on. I see the lighthouse.
Come on, kid. We're almost there. You can finally make your wish.
translation.ko: 거의 다 왔어 드디어 네 소원을 빌 수 있어

translation.en: [gasps] What's wrong?
[weakly] Oh… I don't feel so good.
[Flip] Nemo!
[Carla] Hey, slow down! Slow down!
Pig.
[Flip] What's wrong?
[weakly] Something's not right.
I'm gonna get you home.
You'll be safe at home.
There!
There!
Wait, the Pearl.
I dropped the Pearl. We have to go back.
You get to the lighthouse. I'll get the Pearl, okay? Go.
translation.ko: 등대로 가, 진주를 가져갈게 먼저 가

translation.en: Wait. No, not without you!
-[Flip grunting] -[Nemo] Flip!
Flip!
-[Flip yelling and grunting] -[Nemo] Flip!
[Flip groaning] Nemo!
[Flip, echoing] Nemo, go! Get to the lighthouse!
Say hi to your dad for me.
Flip? Wake up.
[Carla] Philip!
What are you doing?
[Carla] No! Get down! Philip! Philip!
[Carla] No!
Let's go home.
Well, this is gonna be a buttload of paperwork.
translation.ko: 보아하니 등골 빠지게 서류 작업 해야겠군

translation.en: So Nemo, how do you feel? Different?
Big journey, all by yourself.
I see you've found yourself a Pearl.
Guess it's not a myth after all.
I didn't get my dad back.
You had to give up your dream.
I guess you found something more important.
translation.ko: 하지만 더 중요한 걸 찾은 것 같은데?

translation.en: Right, better get to work, then.
You've got a good pig there.
Give it a squeeze for me.
-[Pig grunts] -[Green] Told you.
You have the dream you're meant to have.
translation.ko: 넌 꿔야 할 꿈을 꿀 거고

translation.en: We make sure of that.
What you do next…?
Well, that's up to you.
Ugh! Seriously? Look at this mess!
Can I get a cleaning crew in here pronto? Come on!
translation.ko: 당장 이쪽으로 청소 직원 좀 보내 줘!

translation.en: [crying] I missed you so much.
I miss you.
Race you to the top?
Help!
-Nemo! She's not breathing. -[Carla] Okay.
We got her! We got her. It's okay. Okay.
Did you ever figure it out? What the lighthouse is for?
-[Pig oinking] -It's not to keep ships safe.
No. If we wanted to do that, we'd never let 'em leave harbor, would we?
translation.ko: 배를 지키고 싶으면 항구에 묶어 두는 게 최고겠지

translation.en: [Carla] Nothing. Okay. One, two, three, four, five, six.
translation.ko: 호흡이 없어요 하나, 둘, 셋, 넷, 다섯, 여섯

translation.en: -Come on, Nemo! -[Carla] Seven, eight, nine.
-[Philip] Breathe! -[Carla] Come on. Oh.
To guide you on your journey.
That's right.
So you can see things
translation.ko: 그래서 등대지기가 꿈에서나 그려 볼 모험의 여정을

translation.en: that the lighthouse keeper can only dream of.
translation.ko: 그래서 등대지기가 꿈에서나 그려 볼 모험의 여정을 우리가 떠날 수 있는 거란다

translation.en: I didn't teach you all those things so you could live on an island.
translation.ko: 너더러 섬에서 살라고 그것들을 가르친 게 아니야

translation.en: I did it so that you could know…
you can do anything.
translation.ko: 네가 뭐든 할 수 있다는 걸

translation.en: [Carla] Okay, come on, Nemo.
One, two, three…
I didn't think I could go on without you.
translation.ko: 아빠 없이는 못 살 것 같았어요

translation.en: You traveled to the Sea of Nightmares and came back home safe again.
translation.ko: 넌 악몽의 바다에 갔다가 안전하게 집으로 돌아왔어

translation.en: After that, I don't think the Waking World's gonna be too difficult.
translation.ko: 그 정도면 깨어 있는 세상에서도 끄떡없을 것 같은데

translation.en: But that's up to you.
Life is waiting for you, Nemo.
It would be a shame to miss that.
[crying] I have to go back.
That's my girl.
[takes a deep breath] And you never forget…
how very proud I am of you.
And keep an eye on that brother of mine.
translation.ko: 내 동생 좀 잘 지켜봐 줘

translation.en: He seems normal, but he's not.
Deep down, he's a wild man.
Bye, Dad.
[Carla] Okay, let's go!
Come on, get her over!
There we go! Good girl, Nemo!
-[laughing] Good girl! -[Philip sobbing]
[Carla] Good girl.
You're okay. You're okay. I got you.
And I'm not gonna let go of you ever, okay?
translation.ko: 다시는 네 손 놓지 않을게 알았지?

translation.en: Flip?
[softly] Yeah. [mimics Flip] It's Flip.
And Philip. Philip and Flip.
Flilip? [high-pitched snicker]
-Okay, see ya! -Bye! Bye!
-[Undeadheads groan] -[Nemo] Bye, Jamal. See you tomorrow.
translation.ko: - 잘 가, 자말, 내일 보자 - 내일 봐

translation.en: You know, not a lot of people know this, but I'm actually a master pickpocket.
translation.ko: 아는 사람이 많진 않은데 저 사실 소매치기 달인이에요

translation.en: Oh, come on. No, you're not. [chuckles]
-Oh my G-- -You have very smooth wrists.
[Arya] Wait. What? How did you…?
I'm gonna take you sailing.
Maybe next time you can come with us.
Yeah, I'd love to. [chuckles]
Aces.
Oh. Oh, wait. I need my watch back.
[Philip and Arya laugh] Yeah.
No. No, seriously. Can I get my watch back?
[quietly] Call me.
Oh, great. You're already dressed for bed.
[Nemo] Well, I don't like to be late.
So, what's the plan tonight?
I don't know. I think I might just wander and see what happens.
translation.ko: 몰라요, 그냥 돌아다니면서 어떻게 되나 보려고요

translation.en: Sounds good.
-Night-night, kiddo. I love you. -I love you too.
-I'll try to be on time. -[Nemo giggles]
Sweet dreams.
